author: Bill Schweber
description:
You very likely saw the news in April that China’s Contemporary Amperex Technology Ltd. (CATL), the world’s largest electric-vehicle battery maker, announced a super-fast charging battery that it claims can deliver a 520-km range with just five minutes of charging. The company noted that this world’s first LFP battery features both an 800-km range and […]

The post Can You Really Charge an EV at a Megawatt Rate? appeared first on EE Times.
title: Can You Really Charge an EV at a Megawatt Rate?

author: James Paris and Priyank Jain
description:
Physical verification has reached a turning point. As SoC designs explode in complexity, traditional debug methods are buckling under the weight of modern requirements.

The post A new era of chip-level DRC debug: Fast, scalable and AI-driven   appeared first on EE Times.
title: A new era of chip-level DRC debug: Fast, scalable and AI-driven

author: Yashasvini Razdan
description:
For years, Linux has quietly powered the digital engines of business, running everything from bank transactions to airline bookings. Now, it’s preparing to shift gears from the racks of servers to the car in our driveways, and Red Hat wants to put it in the driver’s seat. With well-established automotive systems already in place, one […]

The post Red Hat Pushes Safety-Certified Linux Into Automotive Sector appeared first on EE Times.
title: Red Hat Pushes Safety-Certified Linux Into Automotive Sector
